saibabu_valluripalli wrote:
> 
> 
> Hi All,
> 
> I am executing JUnit test case using MyEclipse editor. I am seeing
> Failure and Error two out puts.
> What is the difference between a Failure and Error in JUnit?

In JUnit 4, there is no longer a distinction between failures and 
errors. I like that.

In JUnit 3, a failure is /most likely/ a problem with code not passing a 
   test. An error is /most likely/ a problem with configuring your 
environment or platform, causing the test not to execute meaningfully.

Technically, a failure is a failed assertion, while an error is an 
unexpected exception.

Take care.
